column4: hey i just tried to install flashplugin-nonfree and i get this output
Download done.
md5sum mismatch install_flash_player_9_linux.tar.gz
The Flash plugin is NOT installed.
i'm running 7.10 livecd if that matters
have you done this?
no, why should i have to download 120mb of packages to get flash running?
have you actually read it before? (just asking so im not repeating information someone else might have given you.)
yeah, there are all sorts of packages which i don't need, i only need flash, and i am on the live cd
I believe that site is ONLY for flash..im not getting you to download the whole restricted extras package, with all the other stuff.
sudo apt-get install ubuntu-restricted-extras, is what it tells me to do
try sudo aptitude install flashplugin-nonfree
have you done this before?
it installs. but it does not work, here is the error http://pastebin.ca/1030559
what version of ubuntu are you on?
try this http://ubuntuforums.org/showthread.php?t=636397
it works, thanks ^^
no problem...now :P
now i can watch youtube during the reinstallation of my gentoo desktop : D
your kinda going off-topic, watch it please :)
:p
